citation.article-title: Proposal of Craurococcus roseus gen. nov., sp. nov. and Paracraurococcus ruber gen. nov., sp. nov., novel aerobic bacteriochlorophyll a-containing bacteria from soil.

p.s: Description of Craurococcus roseus sp. nov.
Craurococcus roseus (ro.se.us. L. adj. roseus rose-coloured, pink, pink bacterium)
Optimum growth condition is pH 7.5 and 28 to 32°C.
It can not grow at pH 6.8.
Acids are produced from D-arabinose, D-fructose, D-fucose, D-galactose, D-glucose, D-ribose, D-mannose, D-fructose, L-rhamnose and D-xylose.
No acid is produced from lactose, maltose, sucrose, inositol, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol and starch.
Good carbon sources for growth are D-xylose, fumarate and L-glutamate.
Moderate growth occurs with glycerol, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, D-arabinose, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, D-fucose, DL-lactate, malonate, pyruvate, gluconate and L-malate.

D-Mannitol, D-sorbitol, methanol, ethanol, 1,2-propanediol, kerosene, acetate, butyrate, citrate, formate, glycolate, propionate, succinate, phthalate, p-hydroxybenzoate and benzoate are not utilized.
Cells are susceptible to chloramphenicol, penicillin, streptomycin and tetracycline, but are resistant to polymyxin B.
The absorption spectrum of bacteriochlorophyll a in the intact cells has maxima at 800 and 872 nm.
The G+C content of the DNA is 70.5 mol%.
The type strain is NS130T ( = JCM 9933T).
